page.description: Perform some action on an Editor in an Editor set.

item.name: Action name
item.description: Specify the Editor Action that you want to execute. Choices include.

section.title: Open Editor - Edit Value in a Control - Action Properties

item.name: Control to edit
item.description: Specify the name of the control whose value you want to edit in an Editor

item.name: Editor set
item.description: Specify the name of the Editor Set to open.

item.name: Editor name
item.description: Specify the name of the Editor in the specified Editor set to show.

item.name: Editor set
item.description: Specify the name of the Editor Set to commit. The value that was being edited in the current Editor shown in the Editor Set is saved.

item.name: Close Editor Set after commit
item.description: Specify if the Editor Set should be closed after the value in the current Editor is saved.

item.name: Editor set
item.description: Specify the name of the Editor Set to cancel. The value that was being edited in the current Editor shown in the Editor Set is not saved.

section.title: Open Editor - Edit Arbitrary Value - Action Properties

item.name: Editor set
item.description: Specify the name of the Editor Set to open.

item.name: Editor name
item.description: Specify the name of the Editor in the specified Editor set to show.

item.name: Javascript to get value to edit
item.description: Specify the Javascript to execute to get the value to be edited. Your Javascript code must 'return' the value. For example: return {dialog.object}.getValue('somecontrol');

item.name: Javascript to commit the edited value
item.description: Specify the Javacript to execute to commit the edited value. Your Javascript code can reference these variables: 'value' - the edited value, 'settings' - the settings passed into the editor. Of note in 'settings' is 'settings.state.value' - the original value passed to the Editor.
